title: PHPelseifKeyword

metadata.description: Learn about PHPelseifKeyword with clear explanations and practical examples.

content_sections.title: Details
Example
content_sections.code:
<?php
if(5 < 3) {
echo "Five is less than three";
} else 
  if(5 > 4) {
echo "Five is greater than four";
}
?>

content_sections.title: Example

if (...) {
some code here
} elseif (...) {
some

}
?>

content_sections.title: Example

some code here

some code here
}
}
?>

practice_exercises.title: Complete the Code 1
practice_exercises.description: Fill in the missing line to make this code work.
practice_exercises.starter_code:
<?php
if(5 < 3) {
echo "Five is less than three";
# TODO: Complete this line
  if(5 > 4) {
echo "Five is greater than four";
}
?>
practice_exercises.solution:
<?php
if(5 < 3) {
echo "Five is less than three";
} else 
  if(5 > 4) {
echo "Five is greater than four";
}
?>

summary: This tutorial covers PHPelseifKeyword concepts and techniques. You'll learn how to use PHPelseifKeyword effectively, including key principles, common patterns, and practical examples. By the end of this tutorial, you'll have a solid understanding of PHPelseifKeyword and how to apply it in your projects.
